alto:TextBlock.alto:String: OPINION | Allowing YAT candidates to campaign is essential to preserving Princeton's values The bronze tigers guard the steps of Nassau Hall, where the Board of Trustees meets. Candace Do / The Daily Princetonian Young alumni trustee (YAT) election season is upon us again, and that means it's time for your annual reminder that the YAT election is an undemocratic sham . Yet as we revisit this conversation, I wanted to focus on the ways that the YAT process undermines campus free speech , in the hope that this aspect of the election might appeal to the powers that be inside Nassau Hall. — Associate Opinion Editor Thomas Buckley READ THE COLUMN → 7/20/25, 6:23 PM “She’s such a builder”: Kauanui appointed to Indigenous Studies professorship: Your Daily ‘Prince’ Briefing https://mailchi.mp/dailyprincetonian/shes-such-a-builder-kauanui-appointed-to-indigenous-studies-professorship-your-daily-prince-briefing 4/7
